title: 103_hr3531
content: The "Greener Government Act of 1993" aims to promote sustainable economic development by incorporating environmental concerns into the technology development programs of the Federal Government. This is based on findings that investing in environmental technologies can enhance economic competitiveness and environmental security in the United States. The Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 is amended to include provisions for sustainable economic development, integrating environment and economic concerns for long-term development with reduced pollution and efficient energy use. This amendment aims to enhance the competitiveness of American businesses and promote sustainable economic development in regions. The Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 is amended to include provisions for sustainable economic development, integrating environment and economic concerns for long-term development with reduced pollution and efficient energy use. This amendment aims to enhance the competitiveness of American businesses and promote sustainable economic development in regions by inserting sustainable economic development in various sections of the Act. The National Aeronautics and Space Act of 1958 is amended to include the making available of technologies for sustainable economic development, aligning with the goals of the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980. The National Science Foundation Act of 1950 is amended to include fostering education and research for sustainable economic development nationally and internationally, aligning with the goals of promoting long-term economic development with reduced pollution and more efficient use of energy and materials. The term 'United States' refers to the States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and all territories. 'Sustainable economic development' integrates environment and economic concerns for long-term development with reduced pollution and efficient energy/materials use. Amendments in Title 10 replace 'economic growth' with 'sustainable economic development' to align with these definitions. Title 49 Amendment: Section 101(b)(4) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to include "sustainable economic development" after "technological advances".
